item.title: Solving the CDN post-purge thundering herd problem: The PurgeGroup pattern
item.description: Running a full purge of a CDN’s cache can be a risky endeavour. Since a CDN usually heavily caches requests, the origin only receives a fraction of all customers' traffic. For a short amount of time following a purge operation, the CDN’s cache is empty and all incoming requests are forwarded to the origin. If the cache/hit ratio of the CDN is 98%, the number of requests hitting the origin immediately after the purge might be up to 50 times greater than usual.
